mapper.select: select ${selectField} from ${tableName} as tb where is_deleted = 0 order by (id + 0) desc

select ${selectField} from ${tableName} as tb where is_deleted=0
and ${whereFieldName} like CONCAT('%',#{whereFieldValue},'%')
and ${whereFieldName} like CONCAT('%',#{whereFieldValue})
and ${whereFieldName} like CONCAT(#{whereFieldValue},'%')
order by (id+0) desc

SELECT item.item_value as k, item.item_text as v FROM sys_dict dict INNER JOIN sys_dict_item item ON dict.id = item.dict_id where dict.is_deleted = 0 and item.is_deleted = 0 and dict.dict_code = #{dictCode}

SELECT item.item_text FROM sys_dict dict INNER JOIN sys_dict_item item ON dict.id = item.dict_id where dict.is_deleted = 0 and item.is_deleted = 0 and dict_code = #{dictCode} and item.item_value = #{itemValue} limit 1

SELECT item.item_value FROM sys_dict dict INNER JOIN sys_dict_item item ON dict.id = item.dict_id where dict.is_deleted = 0 and item.is_deleted = 0 and dict_code = #{dictCode} and item.item_text = #{itemText} limit 1
SELECT id FROM (SELECT u.id, (SELECT r.id FROM blade_role r WHERE r.role_alias = 'admin' AND FIND_IN_SET(r.id, u.role_id)) AS select_role_id FROM blade_user u) t WHERE select_role_id IS NOT NULL
select * from blade_user_oauth where user_id = #{userId} order by id desc
